WorkItem.Description:
Using IE8 I load up my old character and make changes to it.  I then hit File->Save and choose a new folder and new name.  I hit Ok.  I go to that folder and there is no file created.
 
I attempted this in Firefox but it's so slow and unwieldy I couldn't even GET to the save button.  After loading the char the whole thing basically stops working.
 
I am using Silverlight 4 (checked on MS site that I am up to date).  Attached file I am using.
WorkItem.Summary: [SaveCharacter] Unable to save character, no file is created

Comments.Message: Update: File-> New then imemdiately File->Save has the same behavior so it's not the file itself's problem.

I'm seeing this behavior as well, both on the released beta on elitistjerks.com and r56112 built on my machine. I have tried loading an existing saved character and saving it, unmodified, in a different location. I've also tried File->New, filling in just a character name and realm, and saving that. Both of these fail to produce an output file. No error is reported.
I'm trying to identify the change package that's causing this issue. I have to take off for a while, but I've narrowed it down a bit. r55970 works, but r55987 does not.
Ok - I've narrowed it down as far as I could. It works in 55974. The next two releases (55975 and 55976) do not build, so I could not test them. It does not work in 55977.

I've had the same problem, but after some changes that to me looked like a no-op it started working again, so I'm not really sure if my changes fixed it. You can check build 56117 to see if it works for you.
I tried the latest (56119) and it works. Thank you!
